sec.p: Figure 1A and B reports the PS and PI of all lipid nanoparticles developed as a function of storage time (2°C–8°C). Figure 1A shows the results of SLN and NLC loaded with eucalyptus oil (e) or rosemary oil (r) and prepared by using olive oil (o), as liquid lipid, while Figure 1B shows the results of analogous nanosystems containing sesame oil (s), as liquid lipid.

Independent of nanoparticle composition, PS ranged from 220 to 300 nm and remained almost constant up to 3 months of storage. Similar results were obtained for PI that was close to 0.5, indicating nanoparticle populations characterized by a quite wide PS distribution, stable up to 3 months.
